contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox kommune | name = Flatanger | native_name = | native_name_lang = | other_name = | official_name = | idnumber = 1749 | image_skyline = Rorbu in Lauvsnes.jpg | county = Nord-Trøndelag | district = Namdalen | capital = [[Lauvsnes]] | demonym = Flatangring | language = [[Norwegian language|Neutral]] | munwebpage = www.flatanger.kommune.no | mayor = Reidar Lindseth | mayor_party = [[Liberal Party of Norway|V]] | mayor_as_of = 2003 | area_rank = 219 | area_total_km2 = 459.30 | area_land_km2 = 434.17 | area_water_km2 = 25.13 | population_as_of = 2011 | population_rank = 390 | population_total = 1109 | population_density_km2 = 2.6 | population_increase = -4.2 | latd = 64 | latm = 25 | lats = 11 | longd = 10 | longm = 54 | longs = 28 | utm_zone = 32V | utm_northing = 7145175 | utm_easting = 0591910 | geo_cat = adm2nd }} '''Flatanger''' is a [[List of municipalities of Norway|municipality]] in [[Nord-Trøndelag]] [[Counties of Norway|county]], [[Norway]]. It is part of the [[Namdalen]] [[Districts of Norway|region]]. The administrative centre of the municipality is the village of [[Lauvsnes]]. Other villages include [[Jøssund, Nord-Trøndelag|Jøssund]] and [[Vik, Nord-Trøndelag|Vik]]. ==General information== Flatanger was established as a municipality on 1 January 1871 when it was separated from the large municipality of [[Fosnes]]. Initially, Flatanger had 1,472 residents. It is one of the few municipalities in Norway whose boundaries have not changed since it was established.<ref>{{cite web|first=Dag|last=Jukvam|publisher=[[Statistics Norway|Statistisk sentralbyrå]]|title=Historisk oversikt over endringer i kommune- og fylkesinndelingen|year=1999|url=http://www.ssb.no/emner/00/90/rapp_9913/rapp_9913.pdf|language=Norwegian}}</ref> ===Name=== The municipality is named after the old name for one of the [[fjord]]s in the area, but it is not known which one. The name is composed of two parts: ''flat'', which probably means "shallow water", and ''angr'', which means "[[fjord]] or inlet".<ref name="snl">{{cite web|url=http://snl.no/Flatanger|title=Flatanger|author=Store norske leksikon|authorlink=Store norske leksikon|language=Norwegian|accessdate=2011-08-18}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|title=Norske gaardnavne: Nordre Trondhjems amt|edition=15|authorlink=Oluf Rygh|last=Rygh|first=Oluf|publisher=W. C. Fabritius & sønners bogtrikkeri|year=1903|location=Kristiania, Norge|page=344|url=http://www.dokpro.uio.no/perl/navnegransking/rygh_ng/rygh_bla.prl?enhid=251056&avid=55693|format=[http://www.dokpro.uio.no/ dokpro.uio.no]|language=Norwegian}}</ref> ===Coat-of-arms=== The [[Coat of arms|coat-of-arms]] is from modern times; they were granted in 1990. The arms show three silver [[Chevron (insignia)|chevrons]] on a green background. The design was chosen to represent the [[bow (boat)|bow]] of a boat, seen from the front. ===Churches=== The [[Church of Norway]] has one parish ''(sokn)'' within the municipality of Flatanger. It is part of the [[List of churches in Nord-Trøndelag#Namdal prosti|Namdal]] [[deanery]] in the [[Diocese of Nidaros]]. {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ style="font-size:medium"|'''''Churches in Flatanger''''' !Parish<br />(Sokn)!!Church Name!!Location<br />of the Church!!Year Built |- |rowspan="2"|Flatanger||[[Vik Church (Flatanger)|Vik Church]]||[[Vik, Nord-Trøndelag|Vik]]||1873 |- |[[Løvøy Church]]||[[Lauvøya, Nord-Trøndelag|Lauvøya]]||1871 |} ==Geography== [[File:Sound in Flatanger.jpg|thumb|left|View of a small fjord in Flatanger]] The municipality consists mostly of mainland, but also includes almost 1,400 islands of various sizes. Some of the major islands include [[Bjørøya]], [[Lauvøya, Nord-Trøndelag|Lauvøya]], [[Villa (island)|Villa]], [[Halmøya]], and [[Kvernøya]]. [[Ellingråsa Lighthouse]] is located on the island of [[Bjørøya]] and [[Villa Lighthouse]] is on [[Villa (island)|Villa]]. These islands all lie on the south side of the [[Folda, Nord-Trøndelag|Folda]] [[firth]]. The [[Namsenfjorden]] forms part of the northern boundary of the municipality. ==Politics== In the 2007 municipal elections, Flatanger had the highest vote for the [[Venstre (Norway)|Venstre]] party in all of Norway, at 42.9 per cent. ==Rock Climbing== Flatanger is also home to one of the worlds hardest route climbs. Change 9b+/5.15c+ which was first sent by [[Adam Ondra]] on the 4th of October 2012. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Flatanger}} *{{Wikivoyage-inline|Nord-Trøndelag}} *[http://www.ssb.no/english/municipalities/1749 Municipal fact sheet] from [[Statistics Norway]] {{Nord-Trøndelag}} [[Category:Municipalities of Nord-Trøndelag]] [[Category:Flatanger| ]]
